ngoy

Class Ngoy<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ngoy.Ngoy<T>

  • public class Ngoy<T>
extends Object
    Main entry point to ngoy.

    Use renderString(String, Context, Writer, Config...) or renderTemplate(String, Context, Writer, Config...) for simple templates.

    Use app(Class) to build an 'app' using components, directives, pipes etc.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Ngoy.Builder<T>
      Used to build an 'app'.
      static class  Ngoy.Config
      Configuration used for simple templates.

    • Method Detail

      • app

        public static <T> Ngoy.Builder<T> app(Class<T> appClass)
        Begins building an 'app' using components, pipes etc.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the app
        Parameters:
        appClass - The class or the root component. The class must have at least the Component annotation set. It may have the NgModule annotation set if the app is using other components
        Returns:
        A new builder

      • renderString

        public static void renderTemplate(String template,
                                  Context<?> context,

      • renderString

        public static void renderString(String template,
                                Context<?> context,
                                Writer out,
                                Ngoy.Config... config)
        Renders the given string.

        Example with variable: 

         Ngoy.renderString("hello: {{name}}", Context.of("name", "peter"), System.out);

 >> hello peter
        Example with model: 
         public class Person {
        private final String name;

        public Person(String name) {
                this.name = name;
        }

        public String getName() {
                return name;
        }
 }

 Ngoy.renderString("hello: {{name}}", Context.of(new Person("sam")), System.out);

 >> hello sam
        Parameters:
        template - The template
        context - Execution context used to provide variables and/or a 'model' to the template
        out - Where the processed template is written to
        config - Optional configuration

      • renderTemplate

        public static void renderTemplate(String templatePath,
                                  Context<?> context,
                                  Writer out,
                                  Ngoy.Config... config)
        Renders the given template file/resource.

        Same as renderString(String, Context, Writer, Config...), except that the template is read from the given path.

        Parameters:
        templatePath - path to the template. The template resource is loaded with Class.getResourceAsStream(String)
        context - Execution context used to provide variables and/or a 'model' to the template
        out - Where the processed template is written to
        config - Optional configuration
        See Also:
        renderString(String, Context, Writer, Config...)

      • renderSite

        public void renderSite(Path folder)
        Renders the site/page to the given folder.

        If a RouterModule is present, renders a page for each configured route.

        Parameters:
        folder - target folder. Subdirectories are created as needed

        public void render(OutputStream out)
        Renders the app to the given ouput stream using UTF-8 encoding.
        Parameters:

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroys the app.

        Once called, the app must be built from scratch.

      • getAppInstance

        @Nullable
public T getAppInstance()
        Returns the app instance.
        Returns:
        app instance. Null if the app has been destroyed.
